page.title: 12THE JOHN MUIR COUNTRY PARK 2
page.content: {Fauna}Rabbits infest the stabilised dunes where cockles, sea potatoes and razorshells are cast up from the sand. The rock pools off the golf course and below the promenade are noted for their varied fauna eg barnacles, limpets, chitors, grey top shell, cowrie, and many types of sea slugs. Butterfish, blennies, bootlace worms, broad clawed porcelain crabs and blue-rayed limpets occur. The harbour area is noted for a kittiwake colony with nesting sites on old buildings. Waders such as oystercatcher, dunlin,bar-tailed godwit, turnstone, and golden plover winter at the mouth of the Biel Burn. Eider and Mallard ducks can be found for most of the year.Skylarks breed on grasslands with a summer colony of house-martins on cliff tops.
